snippet: An architectural installation meant to clean the air to a degree equivalent to removing 260 cars from the road has been selected as the winning design in a competition to transform the courtyard of MoMA P.S. 1 in Long Island City, Queens, this...
abstract: An architectural installation meant to clean the air to a degree equivalent to removing 260 cars from the road has been selected as the winning design in a competition to transform the courtyard of MoMA P.S. 1 in Long Island City, Queens, this summer.

headline.main: Air-Cleansing Nylon Star Wins MoMA PS 1 Courtyard Competition
headline.print_headline: MoMA PS1 Winner Is Clean-Air Design
